page.title: 06TRANSPORT
page.content: As in most rural areas, there is a scarcity of public transport. However a bus service runs, somewhat infrequently,from Bideford,3 miles away,to Clovelly and Hartland. A recent survey showed that opinions were equally divided as to its usefulness. A majority of the inhabitants, particularly in outlying farms and districts not served by the bus, rely on cars and motor-bikes. This in turn leads to parking problems in the centre of Abbotsham, where the older houses were built before the advent of garages. This problem is particularly acute when children are being collected from school in the afternoon. Therefore it is the old and the very young who rely most on public transport.
